{name}, I'll show you the task I have to solve from which I am supposed to get a better understanding of the principle of critical thinking. :normal_smile:
, I'll show you the task I have to solve from which I am supposed to get a better understanding of the principle of critical thinking. :normal_smile:
We have to deal with the topic of Climate Change on Earth. In recent years, it has resonated quite a bit among the population. Let's take a closer look at it. :normal_smile:
However, the topic of Climate Change is too general. :sad_smile: For similar general topics, it is useful to look at the problem from several angles and turn it into small digestible topics.
Here are some statements related to this topic. Try to choose one that we will focus on. :normal_smile:

textOption.text: The country in which you live performs very well in recycling compared to other countries.

textResponse.text: The country in which you live performs very well in recycling compared to other countries.

textResponse.text: hypothesis = 'There are no illegal dumps in the country you live in'

textResponse.text: CO2 emissions in the country you live meet the prescribed standards.

textResponse.text: The textile industry has little influence on climate change.

content.text: You can’t survive in this world without critical thinking I will show you a couple of tricks relates to critical thinking and media literacy. :normal_smile:
{name}, I’ve heard some statements about critical thinking. I also heard not all of them are true.
, I’ve heard some statements about critical thinking. I also heard not all of them are true.
Which of these statements do you think is true? :think_smile:

answers.answer: Critical thinking means to critically refute someone else’s statement.
Critical thinking is the effort towards understanding whichever information in the widest context possible.
Critical thinking is psychological view of a person.

content.text: {intro.km_definition = km_definition}
:think_smile: I am  not sure. Wait, I will show you what they write about critical thinking.
I read this about critical thinking :normal_smile:
Critical thinking is the ability to look at information from multiple angles.
Assess whether the information is true or whether someone is trying to manipulate us.
We can judge text, sound, video or an image by critical thinking.
Apparently it's not an ability we can learn in one night :laugh_smile:
The basis of critical thinking is thinking about the information and data received.
We should always ask ourselves questions and take into account several perspectives. It is important to try to reduce prejudice against others.
Is it comprehensible?  :laugh_smile:
Look at the picture I’ve found.
climate/media-detail1.jpg
What emotions does this picture evoke in you?
{intro.question_emotions = question_emotions}
And now look at this image.
climate/media-detail2.jpg
And here goes the last one!
climate/media-detail3.jpg
Is it clear?
I realized that reality can be totally different from what someone mediates and gets to us. :sad_smile:
I heard a few statements. Some should be true, some should not.
What do you think of them? Indicate which of the statements you think is true. :think_smile:

answers.answer: Information is only the beginning of the process of critical thinking, not its result.
answers.explanation: Explanation: The information that comes to us may not always be true and complete. It is the reception of information that should start the process of thinking and evaluating the information.

answers.answer: Effective critical thinking requires only good observational skills.
answers.explanation: Explanation: In addition to observational ability, it requires many other properties and approaches, such as analytical and logical thinking, information retrieval, correct questioning, and so on.

answers.answer: Critical thinking is not a solution, it is the way we look for a solution.
answers.explanation: Explanation: Critical thinking involves a whole set of approaches and procedures to find a solution. Critical thinking is not just the final solution.

answers.answer: Whoever wants to think critically must use the Internet.
answers.explanation: Explanation: The Internet can help to obtain information when searching for answers, this is not a necessary condition. Even in the past, people thought critically and did not use computers.

json.explanation: I have learned that there are initiatives and groups of people who follow sites and portals and, based on the posts and information that are published there, create a list of sites that are more likely to contain misleading information. One of such lists can also be found on the website: www.konspiratori.sk

content.text: And you know what? :think_smile:
They say it is important to ask questions.
When assessing the trustworthyness or rate of manipulation of the post, it is recommended to answer some questions.
We can use 5 key questions of media literacy as a tool to help us decide: Who? What? How? To whom? Why?? :normal_smile:
Let´s take a look at the first of the key questions of media literacy. WHO? :normal_smile:
Who is the author? Write down his name.

answers.recommendation: What to think about: current, out of date, photography, illustration, infographics, related to the topic, unrelated to the topic.
What to think about: current, out of date, animation, reality, related to the topic, unrelated to the topic, body language.
Data and statistical surveys are often misrepresented. They are the most common source of errors with a great impact on the lay but also on the professional public.
Clickbait is a type of text that primarily aims to entice a user to click on a particular link, article title, or video.
What to think about: emotionally colored language, vulgar language, unprofessionalism, playing emotions, clickbaits, argumentative fouls.

content.text: {document.tools = answer}

json.recommendation: Recommendation: the comments and responses below the post can help you find the answer to this question. You will notice how people react to this post and what interested them.

content.text: {document.to_who = answer}

answers.answer: Legislation (eg changes in laws are planned)
Informing (eg to introduce the reader to the issue)
Promotion (eg a new product is launched)

content.text: We are nearing the end of our meeting. I am glad that we were able to spend time together and enrich each other. :normal_smile:
It is necessary to realize that the development of critical thinking requires a lot of time and effort. It's not an ability we can learn over night.:think_smile:

The basis of the critical thinking process is active thinking about the received information and data, their active assessment, asking questions, taking into account several possible perspectives, possible influence of own stereotypes, learned assumptions or prejudices, but also possible interests of those who convey information to us.
When working with articles and following discussions, we may come across differences of opinion, other attitudes and views on the topic.
Differences of opinion can lead to the spread of hate speech and anger. : sad_smile: It is therefore important to realize your role in the online environment as a responsible "digital citizen".
{hack = 0}

It must not be forgotten that the development of critical thinking is a lifelong process. We use critical thinking not only in the online environment but also in finding solutions and decisions in everyday life. :normal_smile:
